meanings.sent1: The soldiers outmarched their rivals with their quick pace.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner outmarched the others to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The ants outmarched the beetles in their race to the picnic crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The determined hiker outmarched the storm to find shelter.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student outmarched her classmates in the school parade.

meanings.definition: To march faster or farther than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The scout troop outmarched the other teams during the competition.
meanings.sent2: The delivery person outmarched the traffic to make all the deliveries on time.
meanings.sent3: The children outmarched the adults in the fun run, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete outmarched her own limits to achieve a new personal record.
meanings.sent5: The explorers outmarched the sunset to reach the campsite before dark.
